results.title: A Curious and diverse flora. Pt. 1: Botany Bay
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, CSIRO, Australian Academy of Science and Tony Chenn
results.brief_description: This film notes the profusion of previously unknown species of plants discovered by Joseph Banks at Botany Bay, such as banksias, the heath-like epacridaceae, the grass-like restionaceae, boronias, xanthorrhoeas, casuarinas and eucalypts. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: A Curious and diverse flora. Parts 1-5
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, CSIRO, Australian Academy of Science and Tony Chenn
results.brief_description: Australian flora is shown as first discovered by Europeans in Botany Bay. Other Australian flora is shown from the isolated area of South Western Australia and from Tasmania. The distinctive flora of eucalypt forests and tropical rainforests is also shown. The program is in five parts. Written and presented by Dr. Peter Valder. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: A curious and diverse flora. Part 2. An Isolated but related flora
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, CSIRO, Australian Academy of Science and Tony Chenn
results.brief_description: Examines the flora of the south-west corner of Western Australia, where of the 4000 species to be found, more than three-quarters are endemic to the area. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: A Crutch for all seasons
results.creator_credit: Burt Martin, Burt Martin Associates and Charles Davis
results.brief_description: An examination of the personal dependencies of three young people - for Frank the crutch was liquor, for Billy it was pot, for Max it was hard stuff. Each becomes involved in tragedy and each, at the brink, turns back from his false dependency.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Burt Martin, Burt Martin Associates and Charles Davis

results.title: A Cruel inheritance (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The problems and options of parents who risk passing on an inherited disease to their children are discussed. The program uses case studies of families with sickle cell anaemia and cystic fibrosis.

results.title: A Creative partnership: the actor and the director
results.creator_credit: Eric Halliday, AFTRS and Cynthia Controp
results.brief_description: Traces a segment of a feature film from casting to the actor-director relationship through these various stages. Very useful for senior media studies students as it makes tangible the relationship between the director and the actors. Also shows the actors negotiating their parts with the director, making input into how the part is to be played. Featuring Michael Caulfield as the director, Noni Hazelhurst and John Derum as the actors.

results.title: A Craven
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Anne Algar
results.brief_description: Smoker Jenny Craven recounts the tortuous process of quitting smoking - which is proving as difficult as they predict when everything seems to be conspiring against her. Features the voices of Jean Kitson and Brian Nankervis.

results.title: A Coronation in the Himalayas
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and N.S. Thapa
results.brief_description: The coronation of the Maharaja of Bhutan in October 1952. The camerman trekked eight days by mule to the remote city of Paro to film the occasion. Bhutanese troops, some in modern uniform and others in ancient Mongolian-style battle dress with shields and helmets, turn out to welcome the party. Processions of Indian troops, Bhutanese troops and lamas on the Coronation Day; the Coronation ceremony performed by Lamas and marked by the presentation of ceremonial scarves to the royal couple; the traditional dancing after the ceremony.

results.title: A Corn husk doll by Deanna Skye
results.creator_credit: B T Film-Sound, National Indian Arts and Crafts and Geoff Voyce
results.brief_description: Deanna Skye, a Cayuga Indian, is one of the few that still carries on the beautiful craft of making corn husk dolls using materials gathered from nature. Pause for a while with an Indian mother as she makes a corn husk doll for her child.
results.title_for_label: A Corn husk doll by Deanna Skye
